text: Bottle thanks to Ed. Pours a cloudy purple with medium pinkish white head that lasts. The aroma is strong boysenberry, oak, lemon, lacto. Medium body, jammy berry, oak, lacto, light acidty, nice sourness, really enjoyed this.

Bottle shared by Tom, Thanks! Pours a murky earthy red with a deep pink head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma is full of berries and earthy wheat with an acid bite underlying. Flavor has a strong sour berry note with some acid and a wheat backbone.
Bomber shared at Darkness day. Cloudy ruby red pour. Tart berry aroma. Tastes follows, really tart, really fruity. Amazing beer.
Bottle shared by Tom - thanks! Dark reddish purple pour. Tart berry. Quite sour. Awesome,

From bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares litafed. Pours a deep, hazy, ruby reddish bordeaux with a medium sized, pink head. Aroma has lots of jammy berries, light funk, vanilla, light blackberry, blueberry, raspberry. Taste is very sour, vanilla spicy, light lactic, lots of juicy fruits, less jammy than the aroma. Light vinegary after taste. High carbonation and a light, juicy body.

Bottle. A big thanks to my friend who is lit. Erik is beautiful. Pours hazy red with a purple head. Aroma is packed with berries. All of them. Maybe raspberries and boys en berries are dominating. Also some leather, funk, lactic tartness and slight vanilla. Taste of sour berries, funk, vanilla, leather, raspberries and vinous notes. Pretty delicate and petite de masooouulll..

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares #litaffam-edition thanks to bursprak. Pours thick deep purple with a small pink head. Aromas of blackberry jam, tannins, lactic tartness, citrus, lemon zest, de garde funk, tannins. Taste is huge blackberry jam, tannins, de garde funk, cheese, citrus, lactic tartness.

Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares "Lit AF" edition. Deep red pour with tiny off white lacings. Tons of juicy berries, yoghurt, raspberries, boysenberries, loganberries, dewberries, marionberries, ollaliberries, blackberries, silvanberries and some lactic notes.
750ml bottle pours a purple color with a lot of effervescent head. Lots boysenberry aroma. Delicious berry fruit flavor, but it dies quickly leaving the less flavorful wheat base.

Bottle thanks to Bobby! Shared 6/10/16.So much De Garde! Couldnt be happier. Lovely cranberry-to-plum colored body shows a fair amount of haziness and a medium-sized, violet-flecked, off-white head that shows moderate retention.Berries, soft oak and light brett acids all rise up powerfully out of the glass. Another massive, well-done fruit nose from the seemingly masters of the game. Its neither jammy, syrupy, overbearing nor too intense (somehow its infinitely sniffable and still enjoyable, despite being so full) and theres room left (lightly) for some wheat and light wood behind it.Strong berry flavors assemble with wood tannins, soft wheat and light vanilla flavors leading to a fairly acidic finish with tons of wonderfully attenuated, dry, luscious berry notes. Its amazing how well the fruit flavor is preserved given how highly attenuated these beers are. Salinity, wood tannin and some bacterial acids all join in on the finish to deepen complexity. Tightly carbonated and with no alcohol or flaw.
Bottle - pours purple - nose and taste of sour lactic acid berry funk and oak - medium body

Bottle. Deep purple color with a rose colored head. Big fruity Tart nose, so jammy and pulpy. Flavor is sharp, lots of fruit as well but this time it sits backseat to the tartness which is surprisingly well tamed for a dG. Pretty damn awesome beer.
